2.text: “How you have helped the powerless and saved the arm that is feeble!

3.text: How you have counseled the unwise and provided fully sound insight!

4.text: To whom have you uttered these words? And whose spirit spoke through you?

5.text: The dead tremble—those beneath the waters and those who dwell in them.

6.text: Sheol is naked before God, and Abaddon has no covering.

7.text: He stretches out the north over empty space; He hangs the earth upon nothing.

8.text: He wraps up the waters in His clouds, yet the clouds do not burst under their own weight.

9.text: He covers the face of the full moon, spreading over it His cloud.

10.text: He has inscribed a horizon on the face of the waters at the boundary between light and darkness.

11.text: The foundations of heaven quake, astounded at His rebuke.

12.text: By His power He stirred the sea; by His understanding He shattered Rahab.

13.text: By His breath the skies were cleared; His hand pierced the fleeing serpent.

14.text: Indeed, these are but the fringes of His ways; how faint is the whisper we hear of Him! Who then can understand the thunder of His power?”
